intro: Morisonia alainiana, commonly known as the Hawaiian morisonia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of Hawaii. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
